content.title: Finding the Average
content.body:
The Mean (\(\bar{x}\)) is the average of the data. 
**Direct Method:** \(\bar{x} = \frac{\sum f_ix_i}{\sum f_i}\)
**Assumed Mean Method:** \(\bar{x} = a + \frac{\sum f_id_i}{\sum f_i}\) (where \(d_i = x_i - a\))

content.title: The Most Frequent Value
content.body:
Mode is the value inside the modal class (class with highest frequency).

\[ \text{Mode} = l + \left( \frac{f_1 - f_0}{2f_1 - f_0 - f_2} \right) \times h \]

content.title: The Middle Value
content.body:
Median is found using the cumulative frequency (cf).

\[ \text{Median} = l + \left( \frac{n/2 - cf}{f} \right) \times h \]

content.explanation: Remember the empirical formula by the sequence 3, 2, 1. **3** Median = **1** Mode + **2** Mean.
